content: Singaporean civil servant and major-general **Ng Chee Khern** [PPA(E)](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam) [LOM](/wiki/Legion_of_Merit) (born 18 October 1965) is a Singaporean civil servant and former [major-general](/wiki/Major-general) who served as [Chief of Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force#List_of_chiefs_of_Air_Force) between 2006 and 2009. He previously served as Permanent Secretary (Smart Nation and Digital Government) under the [Prime Minister's Office](/wiki/Prime_Minister%27s_Office_(Singapore)), and Chairman of the [Government Technology Agency](/wiki/Government_Technology_Agency). He was appointed Permanent Secretary (Manpower) in April 2022. He will be retiring from the public service on 1 December 2025 after more than 40 years in public service. ## Education Ng is an alumnus of [Victoria School](/wiki/Victoria_School) and [Hwa Chong Junior College](/wiki/Hwa_Chong_Junior_College), and was a recipient of the [President's Scholarship](/wiki/President%27s_Scholar) and [Singapore Armed Forces Overseas Scholarship](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces_Overseas_Scholarship) in 1985. He graduated from the [University of Oxford](/wiki/University_of_Oxford) with a [Bachelor of Arts](/wiki/Bachelor_of_Arts) with second upper class honours degree and a [Master of Arts](/wiki/Master_of_Arts_(Oxbridge_and_Dublin)) degree in [philosophy, politics and economics](/wiki/Philosophy,_politics_and_economics) (PPE). He also completed a [Master of Public Administration](/wiki/Master_of_Public_Administration) degree at [Harvard University](/wiki/Harvard_University). ## Military career Ng enlisted in the [Singapore Armed Forces](/wiki/Singapore_Armed_Forces) (SAF) in 1984 and served in the [Republic of Singapore Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force) (RSAF). He flew the [Northrop F-5E Tiger-II](/wiki/Northrop_F-5) and the [F-16](/wiki/General_Dynamics_F-16_Fighting_Falcon) Fighting Falcon. Throughout his military career, Ng held various appointments, including: Commanding Officer, [149 Squadron](/wiki/149_Squadron,_Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force); Commander, [Tengah Air Base](/wiki/Tengah_Air_Base); Director, Joint Operations and Planning Directorate; Chief of Staff (Air Staff). He succeeded [Lim Kim Choon](/wiki/Lim_Kim_Choon) as the Chief of Air Force on 24 March 2006 and relinquished this appointment to his second brother, [Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng), on 10 December 2009. ## Civil Service career After leaving the Air Force, Ng was appointed [Director of the Security and Intelligence Division](/wiki/Security_and_Intelligence_Division#Directors) on 1 September 2010. He left the post on 1 May 2014, and served as Permanent Secretary (Defence Development) at the [Ministry of Defence](/wiki/Ministry_of_Defence_(Singapore)). He was also appointed Second Permanent Secretary at the [Ministry of Health](/wiki/Ministry_of_Health_(Singapore)) on 1 August 2014. Ng is also a member of the boards of various governmental organisations, including: [Public Utilities Board](/wiki/Public_Utilities_Board) (PUB); CapitaMall Trust Management; Chartered Ammunition Industries; ST Aerospace Systems; Changi International Airshow & Events; MDSO Supervisory Board; Construction Industry Development Board; [Defence Science and Technology Agency](/wiki/Defence_Science_and_Technology_Agency); [DSO National Laboratories](/wiki/Defence_Science_Organisation); [Civil Aviation Authority of Singapore](/wiki/Civil_Aviation_Authority_of_Singapore). ## Personal life Ng has two younger brothers. [Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng), a politician and former [lieutenant-general](/wiki/Lieutenant-general) who served as [Chief of Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force#List_of_chiefs_of_Air_Force) between 2009 and 2013, [Chief of Defence Force](/wiki/Chief_of_Defence_Force_(Singapore)) between 2013 and 2015, and [Member of Parliament](/wiki/Parliament_of_Singapore) (MP) for [Pasir Ris–Punggol GRC](/wiki/Pasir_Ris-Punggol_Group_Representation_Constituency) between 2015 and 2020. [Ng Chee Peng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Peng), a former two-star [rear-admiral](/wiki/Rear-admiral) who served as [Chief of Navy](/wiki/Chief_of_Navy_(Singapore)) between 2011 and 2014. ## Awards ### National honours - [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) - [Public Administration Medal (Gold)](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam), in 2016. - [Public Administration Medal (Gold) (Military)](/wiki/Pingat_Pentadbiran_Awam_(Tentera)), in 2005. - [Long Service Medal (Military)](/wiki/Long_Service_Medal_(Military)_(Singapore)), in 2009. ### Foreign honours - [United States](/wiki/United_States) - United States [Legion of Merit](/wiki/Legion_of_Merit) (Commander Degree) - [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia) - [Bintang Swa Bhuwana Paksa Utama](/wiki/Orders,_decorations,_and_medals_of_Indonesia) (1st Class) - [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand) - [Order of the Crown of Thailand](/wiki/Order_of_the_Crown_of_Thailand) (1st Class) - [France](/wiki/France) - [Legion of Honour](/wiki/Legion_of_Honour) (Commander) Military officesPreceded byMajor-General [Lim Kim Choon](/wiki/Lim_Kim_Choon) **Chief of the [Republic of Singapore Air Force](/wiki/Republic_of_Singapore_Air_Force)** 24 March 2006 – 10 December 2009Succeeded byBrigadier-General [Ng Chee Meng](/wiki/Ng_Chee_Meng)
